entity

Class Activity

  • entity.Activity
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Assignable, Bean, EventAware, Retireable, Validatable

    public class Activity
implements Bean, Validatable, Assignable, Retireable, EventAware
    An activity is a instance of work assigned to a user.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      ActivityClass ActivityClass
      The class of the activity.
      ActivityPattern ActivityPattern
      Pattern that created this activity. It it was not created from a pattern, then this is null.
      java.lang.String ActivityStatus
      activity status
      java.lang.String ApprovalIssue
      Reason approval is needed. This field should only be set for approval activities.
      java.lang.String ApprovalRationale
      Rationale for approving/rejecting the activity. This field should only be set for approval activities.
      java.lang.Boolean Approved
      Whether the activity is approved. This is null if not relevant or undecided.
      User AssignedByUser
      User who assigned this entity.
      Group AssignedGroup
      Group to which this entity is assigned; null if none assigned
      AssignableQueue AssignedQueue
      Either the Queue to which this entity is assigned (if AssignmentStatus is 'assigned'), the Queue to which the system suggests assignment (if AssignmentStatus is 'manual'), or null if none assigned. Only one of AssignedUserID or AssignedQueueID should be non null.
      User AssignedUser
      Either the User to which this entity is assigned (if AssignmentStatus is 'assigned'), the User to which the system suggests assignment (if AssignmentStatus is 'manual'), or null if none assigned. Only one of AssignedUserID or AssignedQueueID should be non null.
      java.util.Date AssignmentDate
      Time when entity last assigned
      AssignmentStatus AssignmentStatus
      Typelist describing assignment status.
      boolean AssociatedWithDocumentTemplate
      true if this activity is associated with document template
      boolean AssociatedWithEmailTemplate
      true if this activity is associated with an email template
      java.lang.Boolean AutoGenerated
      True if the activity was generated automatically; never fully implemented. Instead, customers can create an extension field and set it after creating an activity in a rule to indicate how the activity was created
      java.lang.Integer BeanVersion
      Auto-incremented object version
      java.util.Date CloseDate
      Date and time when this entity was closed. (Not applicable to all assignable entities)
      User CloseUser
      The user who closed this activity.
      java.lang.String Command
      A Gosu command to execute for this activity.
      java.util.Date CreateTime
      Timestamp when the object was created
      User CreateUser
      User who created the object
      java.lang.String Description
      Description of the activity.
      java.lang.String DocumentTemplate
      The id of an associated document template. The id and language gets passed to IDocumentTemplateSource to retrieve the DocumentTemplateDescriptor. This property should not be used by applications.
      java.lang.String EmailTemplate
      The id of an associated email template. The id gets passed to IEmailTemplateSource to retrieve the EmailTemplateDescriptor.
      java.util.Date EndDate
      Time the event is scheduled to terminate or null if the activity is not a scheduled event.
      java.lang.Boolean Escalated
      True if the activity has been escalated.
      java.util.Date EscalationDate
      When the activity will be escalated if it isn't yet completed; this is null if the activity is never escalated.
      java.lang.Boolean ExternallyOwned
      Whether the activity is externally owned.
      Key ID
      Internally managed primary key
      java.util.Date LastViewedDate
      When this activity was last viewed by the assignee. If never viewed, this is null.
      java.lang.Long LoadCommandID
      LoadCommand for load where row was created. If not null this object was loaded via the loader.
      java.lang.String LogicalName
      Logical name of the activity. Used by the internal workflow engine.
      java.lang.Boolean Mandatory
      True if the activity must be completed and cannot be skipped.
      boolean Overdue
      Returns a boolean indicating whether or not the activity is overdue
      Group PreviousGroup
      Group to which this entity was previously assigned.
      AssignableQueue PreviousQueue
      Queue to which this entity was previously assigned.
      User PreviousUser
      User to which this entity was previously assigned.
      Priority Priority
      Priority of the activity with respect to other activities.
      java.lang.String PublicID
      ID or primary key of the row in the external system to which this row is mapped
      java.lang.Boolean Recurring
      Whether this activity is recurring.
      Activity RelatedActivity
      For assignment review activities, points to the activity to be assigned. Otherwise, this is null.
      Relatedactivity[] RelatedactivityArray
      java.lang.Long RetiredValue
      Whether the entity is still in use. A value of 0 means that the entity is not retired. If the entity is retired from active use, this field has a non-zero value equal to the entity's ID. Once an entity is retired, it should not be unretired.
      java.lang.String ShortSubject
      A very brief title for the activity e.g., displayable in a calendar; this is associated with its pattern.
      ActivityStatus Status
      Status of the activity.
      java.lang.String Subject
      A brief title for the activity; this is associated with its pattern.
      Activity Subtype
      Identifies a particular subtype within a supertype table; each subtype of a supertype has its own unique subtype value
      java.util.Date TargetDate
      If this activity is a task, time by which a person should complete the task; if not completed by this time, the task is considered overdue. If this activity is an event, the time the event is scheduled to start.
      ActivityType Type
      Type of the activity.
      java.util.Date UpdateTime
      Timestamp when the object was last updated
      User UpdateUser
      User who last updated the object
      boolean UpdatedSinceLastViewed
      Returns a boolean indicating whether or not this activity was updated since the last time it was viewed.
      ValidationLevel ValidationLevel
      Validation level that this object passed (if any) before it was stored.
      Workflow Workflow
      Optional pointer to the workflow this activity is associated with.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void approve()
      If the activity is open, marks the activity as approved and closed, runs associated rules and, if necessary, notifies its associated workflow.

      If the activity is not open, this is a no-op
      void assignToQueue(AssignableQueue queue)
      Assigns the activity to the specified queue, which must be non null. If the engine cannot assign the item to the requested queue, it will throw an exception indicating the reason.
      boolean autoAssign()
      boolean canApprove()
      Returns a boolean indicating whether or not the given activity can be approved. Returns true if: the activity is of type Approval the activity is of status Open the activity is Assigned the activity is either assigned to the given user or the user has the "approveany" permission
      boolean canAssign()
      Returns a boolean indicating whether or not the given activity can be assigned. Returns true iff: the activity is of type Approval the activity is of status Open the activity is not assigned to a queue the user has the "assignactivity" permission
      boolean canComplete()
      Returns a boolean indicating whether or not the given activity can be completed. Returns true iff: the activity is of type General the activity is of status Open the activity is Assigned the activity is not assigned to a queue the user has the modify activity permission for this activity
        Note this test does not check anything particular to the activity and its requirements for completion.
      boolean canEdit()
      Returns a boolean indicating whether or not the given activity can be edited. Returns true iff: the activity is of status Open the user has the modify activity permission for this activity
      boolean canMakeMandatory()
      Indicates whether or not the current user can toggle the mandatory flag on this activity.
      boolean canRecur()
      Returns a boolean indicating whether or not the given activity can generate a recurring activity. Returns true iff: the activity's isRecurring property is non-null and equal to TRUE
      boolean canSkip()
      Returns true if the user can skip the activity based on the following: the activity is a GENERAL or APPROVAL_DENIED activity the activity is open the activity is assigned the activity is not mandatory the activity is not assigned to a queue the user has permission to modify the activity
      void complete()
      Completes an activity
      KeyableBean copy()
      Makes a copy of the current bean. This method will also deep copy all owned arrays in this object graph.
      KeyableBean copy(block(field:IEntityPropertyInfo):Boolean shouldCopy)
      Makes a copy of the current bean. This method will also deep copy all properties where shouldCopy() returns true. For example, the above copy method simply calls this method with the block: \ field ->field typeis IArrayPropertyInfo && field.Owned
      void defer()
      Synonym for {@link #skip()}, retained for backwards compatibility
      com.guidewire.pl.system.database.Query<Bean> findViewableNotes()
      Find all nodes that are viewable by the current user
      java.util.Collection<T> getAddedArrayElements(IPropertyReference<KeyableBean,java.lang.Object[]> ref)
      Delegates to getAddedArrayElements(IArrayPropertyInfo), using the referenced property literal.
      java.util.Collection<T> getChangedArrayElements(IPropertyReference<KeyableBean,java.lang.Object[]> ref)
      Delegates to getChangedArrayElements(IArrayPropertyInfo), using the referenced property literal.
      T getOriginalValue(IPropertyReference<KeyableBean,T> ref)
      Delegates to getOriginalValue(IEntityPropertyInfo), using the referenced property literal.
      java.util.Collection<T> getRemovedArrayElements(IPropertyReference<KeyableBean,java.lang.Object[]> ref)
      Delegates to getRemovedArrayElements(IArrayPropertyInfo), using the referenced property literal.
      boolean isArrayElementAddedOrRemoved(IPropertyReference<KeyableBean,java.lang.Object[]> ref)
      Delegates to isArrayElementAddedOrRemoved(IArrayPropertyInfo), using the referenced property literal.
      boolean isArrayElementChanged(IPropertyReference<KeyableBean,java.lang.Object[]> ref)
      Delegates to isArrayElementChanged(IArrayPropertyInfo), using the referenced property literal.
      boolean isFieldChanged(IPropertyReference<KeyableBean,java.lang.Object> ref)
      Delegates to isFieldChanged(IEntityPropertyInfo), using the referenced property literal.
      Note newNote()
      Will create a new Note
      void reject()
      If the activity is open, marks the activity as not approved and closed, runs associated rules and, if necessary, notifies its associated workflow.

      If the activity is not open, this is a no-op
      void setActivityPattern(ActivityPattern pattern, java.util.Date targetDate, java.util.Date escalationDate)
      Sets the activity pattern with overrides for the starting points for the target and escalation dates. The target date and escalation date are used to override the starting point of target date and escalation date, respectively. The same date calculation still applies
      void setActivityPatternAndCopy(ActivityPattern pattern)
      Sets the activity pattern and copy pattern's values into this activity,
      void setActivityPatternAndCopy(ActivityPattern pattern, java.util.Date targetDate, java.util.Date escalationDate)
      Sets the activity pattern and copy the pattern's values into this activity. This overrides for the starting points for the target and escalation dates. The target date and escalation date are used to override the starting point of target date and escalation date, respectively. The same date calculation still applies
      void setUp(Assignee assignee)
      Calls pre-setup rules, assigns the activity, then calls post-setup rules. This does not commit the activity to the database
      void setUpAuto()
      void skip()
      Sets an activity's state to skipped. If the activity is not open, does nothing at all.

        Either the User to which this entity is assigned (if AssignmentStatus is 'assigned'), the User to which the system suggests assignment (if AssignmentStatus is 'manual'), or null if none assigned. Only one of AssignedUserID or AssignedQueueID should be non null.

        AssignableQueue AssignedQueue
        Either the Queue to which this entity is assigned (if AssignmentStatus is 'assigned'), the Queue to which the system suggests assignment (if AssignmentStatus is 'manual'), or null if none assigned. Only one of AssignedUserID or AssignedQueueID should be non null.

      • copy

        KeyableBean copy(block(field:IEntityPropertyInfo):Boolean shouldCopy)
        Makes a copy of the current bean. This method will also deep copy all properties where shouldCopy() returns true. For example, the above copy method simply calls this method with the block: \ field ->field typeis IArrayPropertyInfo && field.Owned
        Parameters:
        shouldCopy -
        Returns:

      • skip

        void skip()
        Sets an activity's state to skipped. If the activity is not open, does nothing at all.

      • canComplete

        boolean canComplete()
        Returns a boolean indicating whether or not the given activity can be completed. Returns true iff:
        1. the activity is of type General
        2. the activity is of status Open
        3. the activity is Assigned
        4. the activity is not assigned to a queue
        5. the user has the modify activity permission for this activity
            6. Note this test does not check anything particular to the activity and its requirements for completion.
        Returns:
        true if the given activity can be completed

      • assignToQueue

        void assignToQueue(AssignableQueue queue)
        Assigns the activity to the specified queue, which must be non null. If the engine cannot assign the item to the requested queue, it will throw an exception indicating the reason.
        Parameters:
        queue - The queue to which the item should be assigned - must be specified. If not known, use autoAssign(item) instead.

      • defer

        void defer()
        Synonym for {@link #skip()}, retained for backwards compatibility

      • reject

        void reject()
        If the activity is open, marks the activity as not approved and closed, runs associated rules and, if necessary, notifies its associated workflow.

        If the activity is not open, this is a no-op

      • newNote

        Note newNote()
        Will create a new Note
        Returns:
        the new note

      • canRecur

        boolean canRecur()
        Returns a boolean indicating whether or not the given activity can generate a recurring activity. Returns true iff:
        1. the activity's isRecurring property is non-null and equal to TRUE
        Returns:
        true if the given activity can recur

      • canApprove

        boolean canApprove()
        Returns a boolean indicating whether or not the given activity can be approved. Returns true if:
        1. the activity is of type Approval
        2. the activity is of status Open
        3. the activity is Assigned
        4. the activity is either assigned to the given user or the user has the "approveany" permission
        Returns:
        true if the given activity can be approved

      • setUp

        void setUp(Assignee assignee)
        Calls pre-setup rules, assigns the activity, then calls post-setup rules. This does not commit the activity to the database
        Parameters:
        assignee - the assignee to which the activity should be assigned

      • approve

        void approve()
        If the activity is open, marks the activity as approved and closed, runs associated rules and, if necessary, notifies its associated workflow.

        If the activity is not open, this is a no-op

      • canSkip

        boolean canSkip()
        Returns true if the user can skip the activity based on the following:
        1. the activity is a GENERAL or APPROVAL_DENIED activity
        2. the activity is open
        3. the activity is assigned
        4. the activity is not mandatory
        5. the activity is not assigned to a queue
        6. the user has permission to modify the activity
        Returns:
        true if the given activity can be skipped

      • canAssign

        boolean canAssign()
        Returns a boolean indicating whether or not the given activity can be assigned. Returns true iff:
        1. the activity is of type Approval
        2. the activity is of status Open
        3. the activity is not assigned to a queue
        4. the user has the "assignactivity" permission
        Returns:
        true if the given activity can be assigned

      • setUpAuto

        void setUpAuto()

      • complete

        void complete()
        Completes an activity

      • canEdit

        boolean canEdit()
        Returns a boolean indicating whether or not the given activity can be edited. Returns true iff:
        1. the activity is of status Open
        2. the user has the modify activity permission for this activity
        Returns:
        true if the given activity can be edited

      • setActivityPattern

        void setActivityPattern(ActivityPattern pattern,
                      java.util.Date targetDate,
                      java.util.Date escalationDate)
        Sets the activity pattern with overrides for the starting points for the target and escalation dates. The target date and escalation date are used to override the starting point of target date and escalation date, respectively. The same date calculation still applies
        Parameters:
        pattern - The activity pattern used to populate the activity fields
        targetDate - The target date used to override the target starting point.
        escalationDate - The escalation date used to override the escalation starting point

      • findViewableNotes

        com.guidewire.pl.system.database.Query<Bean> findViewableNotes()
        Find all nodes that are viewable by the current user
        Returns:
        a query over Note

      • setActivityPatternAndCopy

        void setActivityPatternAndCopy(ActivityPattern pattern)
        Sets the activity pattern and copy pattern's values into this activity,
        Parameters:
        pattern - The activity pattern used to populate the activity fields

      • setActivityPatternAndCopy

        void setActivityPatternAndCopy(ActivityPattern pattern,
                             java.util.Date targetDate,
                             java.util.Date escalationDate)
        Sets the activity pattern and copy the pattern's values into this activity. This overrides for the starting points for the target and escalation dates. The target date and escalation date are used to override the starting point of target date and escalation date, respectively. The same date calculation still applies
        Parameters:
        pattern - The activity pattern used to populate the activity fields
        targetDate - The target date used to override the target starting point.
        escalationDate - The escalation date used to override the escalation starting point

      • canMakeMandatory

        boolean canMakeMandatory()
        Indicates whether or not the current user can toggle the mandatory flag on this activity.
        Returns:
        true if the current user can toggle the mandatory flag on this activity, false otherwise
